Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Eli Cohen, Exec. Director, The Crown Heights Jewish Community Council (CHJCC), 387 Kingston Ave. Brooklyn, N.Y. 11225.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Cumbo.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Eli Cohen, Executive Director, The Crown Heights Jewish Community Council (CHJCC), 387 Kingston Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11225.

Council Member Cumbo moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of February 15, 2017 and March 1, 2017 be adopted as printed by Council Member Crowley.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Koslowitz moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of February 15, 2017 and March 1, 2017 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Kallos:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 1640 Second Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 8, Application No. 20175241 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 1640 Second Ave, Manhattan (20175241 TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Environmental Protection

Resolution calling upon President Donald Trump to fully fund the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, the Institute of Museum and Library Services, the National Endowment for the Arts and the National Endowment for the Humanities, and not to eliminate or diminish any of these agencies in any form.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 2 Council Members formally noted their objection to the passage of this item: 
Council Members Borelli and Matteo.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Calling upon President Trump to fully fund the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, the Institute of Museum and Library Services, the National Endowment for the Arts & the National Endowment for the Humanities.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 50 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on  Tuesday, April 25, 2017.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Application No. 20175241 TCM pursuant to Section 20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of Coliemore Inc., d/b/a Five Mile Stone, for a revocable consent to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 1640 2nd Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 8, Council District 5. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 20-226 of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 1640 Second Ave, Manhattan (20175241 TCM)
